alert.note: Alert for Guam (Guam) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Warning issued January 18 at 3:47AM ChST until January 19 at 6:00AM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CHST FRIDAY... ...HIGH RISK OF RIP CURRENTS THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Dangerously large breaking waves of 13 to 17 feet and extremely dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...West, north, and east facing reefs of the Marianas. * WHEN...Until 6 AM ChST Friday. * IMPACTS...Breaking waves can sweep people off jetties and docks, and into dangerous seas. Life-threatening swimming conditions and significant beach erosion can be expected. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The swell is becoming more northeasterly, bringing hazardous surf and high rip current risk to east facing reefs.
info.instruction: Everyone should remain out of the water due to life-threatening surf conditions. Stay off of jetties, piers, and other waterside infrastructure.
